messages: fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (21:05): Safari/WebKit has never given a roadmap to shipping for anything
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (21:05): and we've been known to disable trunk features on release branches
fe70b49783daa65bcb249805fb3a2b24 (21:05): I don't think Acid3 can be blamed
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:14): It's Acid3's fault. kthxbai.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:22): we're obviously not going to ship Acid3 fixes in Safari 3.1, since it has already shipped
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:31): WHAT!?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:31): You're kidding, right?
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:33): what is the smallest SVG spec?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:33): that's right, we can't go back in time
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:33): 14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4: probably the VML note that MS proposed is the smallest SVG spec :)
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:34): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, seriously, what's the smallest?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:34): I honestly don't know, but I'd have to guess SVG 1.0
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:35): that said, I think SVG Tiny 1.2 is much more clean and well-defined
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:35): I should clarify--I meant number of features, rather than spec length
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:35): and though it has features some people don't like, is a better implementation target
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:35): a long spec detailing a small number features would be best
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:35): guesses 1.1 Tiny/Mobile
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:35): oh, then probably SVG Tiny 1.2
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:36): but that doesn't have scripting support, so most browsers already pass that by
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:37): each version of SVG has somewhat incompatibly changed the semantics (mostly minor)
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:37): I want to use SVG for a purpose that doesn't have many requirements
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:37): for instance 1.1 technically requires you to catastrophically fail at rendering any time any attribute value is invalid
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:37): just simple drawings
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:37): then SVG Tiny 1.1
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:38): hmm, it has animation
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:38): guess I have to make SVG 1.1 ReallyTiny
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:38): interactivity is not required either
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:39): I don't think there is an SVG spec that is only suitable for simple drawings and no more
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:39): then you can simply do a profile of SVG
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:39): some are more out of control than others
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:39): there's an appendix that describes various profiles, including static
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:39): lemme find it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:40): http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/feature.html
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:41): see http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/feature#SVG-static
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:41): hmm, still has xlink
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:41): I don't need links
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:42): that's also used for inbound links, like image references
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:42): well, I only want to allow data URLs for those
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:42): do I have to use xlink to get that?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:43): is puzzled why that's a problem
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:43): it's not like that's a big implementation burden
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:43): well, "src" would be three characters
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:44): it is not hard to implement, I agree
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:44): just verbose
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:44): "r" would be one character
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:44): the size of a data:URL is going to dwarf any attribute name
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:45): but now I have to use namespaces
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:45): or more than one, anyway
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:45): always a sign of trouble
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:45): is going to avoid this religious issue
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:46): well, it's not religious in this case
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:46): I don't need this to be extensible, so namespaces aren't helping much :)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:46): netsplit!!! run for your lives!
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:47): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6, so are the features discussed in this appendix the same things I would find in SVG Tiny?
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:47): or is there a table that explains this concisely somewhere?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:48): 14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4: not sure... look in SVG Tiny 1.1 for the featurestrings there
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:48): I don't know of such a table, but I think it would behoove the SVG WG to make one
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:49): I'm happy to bring that up, or champion it if you sent an email to www-svg explaining your use case
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:49): well, I'm still exploring right now, so I think my explanation would be bad
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:49): but I will do that eventually
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:50): ok, that'd be great
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:50): interestingly enough, I was just writing an email about how static SVG is taking off more and more
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:52): it looks like the Mobile/Tiny stuff insists on interactivity
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:53): 14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4: I think an SVG Core spec for static SVG, without interactivity or animation, would be interesting
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:54): or SVG Static, whatever
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:54): do you think it would take a long time to specify? or would it be a cut and paste job?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:54): it might be of interest to drawing tools and other scenarios where they think SVG is too heavy
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:55): 14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4: more or less the latter

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:56): but finding time and resources to do that within the WG might be hard, considering that most of the participants are interested in dynamic, scripted, animated, and interactive aspects of SVG
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:57): seems like it would be uncontroversial as a W3C Note
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:57): if this is of interest to Mozilla, and you put some resources in (and maybe helped find other participants who would do the same), I think we could do it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:57): I don't think it would be controversial as a spec, actually
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:57): just a matter of resources
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:57): tbh, I'm kind of dismayed it doesn't already exist, and wasn't considering resource allocation
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:58): so I'll see how this goes
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:58): ok, let me know
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:58): like I said, that featurestring is a reasonable profile
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:59): is curious what 14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 is planning... is this for Mozilla?
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:59): yes, it is, but it's just my pet project
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:59): guesses it's for Thunderbird
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (21:59): that's cool
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (21:59): nah, I don't work on Thunderbird much
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:00): wonders what one would call a project about pets, to distinguish it from the term 'pet project'
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (22:01): but this is unrelated to Firefox's general SVG stuff
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:01): taxidermy?
14af4ca97e316b17ea96286dc6882fd4 (22:01): sorry I'm being so dodgy, I'm not ready to talk much about it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:07): was just watching a heron fishing in his backyard pond :D
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (22:07): really cool, the way they move... keeping their head in the same position while they walk up underneath it for each step
